enumDescriptions: The default behavior for Sigil. A friendly computer science tutor intended for novice students, who will provide plenty of direct guidance.
sigil.persona.description: Currently active persona that Sigil will embody in its responses.

sigil.personalizeResponses.description: When enabled, Sigil will attempt to create a personalized prompt when you provide feedback and use it to tailor its responses.

sigil.personalizedPrompt.description: Extra preferences that Sigil will use to curate its responses for you.

sigil.logChats.description:
When this option is set to true, you consent that your interactions with SIGIL-PS may be anonymously collected for research purposes and written about in written research that will be publicly available. To reiterate, none of the collected data will contain identifying information about you, and no identifying information about you will appear in written reports. This data will include

- your prompts,
- the code you have open in VS Code, and
- the chatbot's responses 

Additionally, we will collect basic identifying information from the public GitHub profile you are using with the SIGIL-PS. This data will not be publicly disclosed. This data will include your

- username, 
- full name, and
-email

sigil.developerSettings.test.description: Development setting: when enabled, SIGIL-PS will use the test environment for the backend.

sigil.developerSettings.apiUrl.description: Development setting: custom base URL for the SIGIL-PS API for testing purposes (i.e. localhost). Only applies when in test environment.
